name: create-signed-distance-volume
author: Connectome Workbench Developers
description:
Create signed distance volume from surface.

Computes the signed distance function of the surface.  Exact distance is calculated by finding the closest point on any surface triangle to the center of the voxel.  Approximate distance is calculated starting with these distances, using dijkstra's method with a neighborhood of voxels.  Specifying too small of an exact distance may produce unexpected results.  Valid specifiers for winding methods are as follows:

EVEN_ODD (default)
NEGATIVE
NONZERO
NORMALS

The NORMALS method uses the normals of triangles and edges, or the closest triangle hit by a ray from the point.  This method may be slightly faster, but is only reliable for a closed surface that does not cross through itself.  All other methods count entry (positive) and exit (negative) crossings of a vertical ray from the point, then counts as inside if the total is odd, negative, or nonzero, respectively.

inputs.name: refspace
inputs.description: a volume in the desired output space (dims, spacing, origin)

inputs.name: opt_roi_out
inputs.description: output an roi volume of where the output has a computed value

inputs.name: opt_fill_value_value
inputs.description: specify a value to put in all voxels that don't get assigned a distance: value to fill with (default 0)

inputs.name: opt_exact_limit_dist
inputs.description: specify distance for exact output: distance in mm (default 5)

inputs.name: opt_approx_limit_dist
inputs.description: specify distance for approximate output: distance in mm (default 20)

inputs.name: opt_approx_neighborhood_num
inputs.description: voxel neighborhood for approximate calculation: size of neighborhood cube measured from center to face, in voxels (default 2 = 5x5x5)

inputs.name: opt_winding_method
inputs.description: winding method for point inside surface test: name of the method (default EVEN_ODD)
